content.text:
# Wara Buland Khan

Wara Buland Khan (}}) is a small village near Khewra town in Jehlum Tehsil, of  Jhelum District, Punjab, Pakistan. The village is approximately 5 kilometres (3.1 mi) northwest of Pind Dadan Khan on the Choa Sedan Shah-Pind Dadan Khan road. Since 1947, Chakwal was a part of District Jehlum. In 1985, Jehlum became a district with four tehsils. The district is administratively subdivided into four tehsils: Tehsil Jehlum, Tehsil Dina, Sohawa Tehsil, and Pind Dadan Khan Tehsil.  It is located 90 km southeast of the federal capital, Islamabad.
